guidelines.title: Baseline Fetal Heart Rate Assessment
guidelines.clinical_significance: Baseline FHR is the mean FHR rounded to increments of 5 bpm during a 10-minute window, excluding accelerations, decelerations, and periods of marked variability.

guidelines.title: Fetal Heart Rate Variability Assessment
guidelines.clinical_significance: Variability reflects the interplay between sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous systems. Moderate variability is the most reassuring feature of FHR.

guidelines.title: Fetal Heart Rate Accelerations

interpretation.present: Reassuring - indicates fetal wellbeing and intact neurological function
interpretation.absent: May indicate fetal sleep cycle (20-40 min) or compromise if prolonged

guidelines.clinical_significance: Presence of accelerations is highly predictive of normal fetal acid-base status. Absence alone is not pathological.

guidelines.title: Fetal Heart Rate Decelerations Classification

early_decelerations.definition: Gradual decrease in FHR with onset to nadir ≥30 seconds

variable_decelerations.definition: Abrupt decrease in FHR with onset to nadir <30 seconds

significance.mild: Occasional, returns to baseline - usually benign
significance.severe: Prolonged (>60s), deep (>60 bpm), slow recovery - non-reassuring

variable_decelerations.management: Position change, oxygen, amnioinfusion if recurrent

late_decelerations.definition: Gradual decrease in FHR with onset to nadir ≥30 seconds
late_decelerations.timing: Onset after contraction begins, nadir after contraction peak
late_decelerations.management: Immediate intervention: position change, oxygen, IV fluids, discontinue oxytocin, consider expedited delivery

prolonged_decelerations.definition: Decrease in FHR ≥15 bpm from baseline
prolonged_decelerations.management: Emergency response, assess for reversible causes, prepare for possible delivery

guidelines.clinical_significance: Deceleration patterns provide critical information about fetal oxygenation and cardiovascular response to labor stress.

guidelines.title: NICHD Three-Tier Fetal Heart Rate Classification

category_1.label: Normal
category_1.interpretation: Strongly predictive of normal fetal acid-base status

category_2.label: Indeterminate
criteria: Any pattern not classified as Category 1 or 3

Examples: bradycardia with normal variability, tachycardia, minimal variability, absent variability without recurrent decelerations, marked variability, recurrent variable decelerations with moderate variability, prolonged deceleration ≥2 min but <10 min
category_2.interpretation: Not predictive of abnormal fetal acid-base status but requires evaluation and continued surveillance
category_2.management: Enhanced monitoring, address reversible causes, consider ancillary tests (scalp stimulation, fetal scalp pH)

category_3.label: Abnormal
criteria: Absent variability AND any of: recurrent late decelerations, recurrent variable decelerations, bradycardia
category_3.interpretation: Predictive of abnormal fetal acid-base status at the time of observation
category_3.management: Prompt evaluation, resuscitative measures, expedite delivery

guidelines.clinical_significance: Standardized classification system to guide clinical decision-making and communication among providers.

details: Assess maternal vital signs and hydration
Reduce uterine activity (discontinue oxytocin if applicable)
Fetal scalp stimulation to elicit acceleration
Consider fetal scalp pH if available (pH >7.25 reassuring, 7.20-7.25 borderline, <7.20 pathological)
Assess for other signs of fetal compromise
Notify physician of persistent Category 2 patterns
Prepare for possible emergent cesarean delivery
Position change (lateral, knee-chest if cord prolapse suspected)
If fully dilated and low station: assisted vaginal delivery
If not fully dilated or high station: emergency cesarean
Target decision-to-delivery interval: 30 minutes or less

risk_modifiers.impact: Increased risk of fetal macrosomia, shoulder dystocia, and metabolic complications
risk_modifiers.monitoring_adjustment: More frequent assessment, lower threshold for intervention

risk_modifiers.impact: Increased risk of placental insufficiency and fetal growth restriction
risk_modifiers.monitoring_adjustment: Enhanced surveillance, consider delivery at 37 weeks if well-controlled

risk_modifiers.impact: Increased risk of oligohydramnios, meconium aspiration, and placental senescence
risk_modifiers.monitoring_adjustment: Twice-weekly NST, consider induction at 41 weeks

risk_modifiers.impact: Chronic placental insufficiency, increased risk of stillbirth
risk_modifiers.monitoring_adjustment: Daily fetal monitoring, doppler assessment, lower threshold for delivery
Consider amnioinfusion during labor, closer monitoring of variable decelerations
